page.title: 09Mr.Peat Remembers
page.content: {An interview with our school caretaker In 1926 when Mr.Peat was 5 years old he started at Fawley school.When Fawley school first opened only 37 children went there.He left school when he was 14 but before he left he did work on the fields harvesting the crops.All the children in the area went to Fawley school. When Mr.Peat was 9 he got up at 6.30 in the morning and did a milk round before school which started at 9.00.After school at about 3.30 he would do another milk round,then he would work in somebodies garden. In those days they didn't have taps in their house.Mr.Peat had to pump water out of a well.If he had the time he would pump out the people's cesspit.For doing all this work he would get 5 shillings a week which in our money would be 25p.
